titleStmt.title: A dolefull ditty, or sorowfull sonet of the Lord Darly, sometime king of Scots, neuew to the noble and worthy King Henry the eyght and is to be song to the tune of blacke and yellowe.
titleStmt.author: H. C.

publicationStmt.publisher: Imprinted at London by Thomas Gosson dwelling in Paternoster Rowe, next to the signe of the Castell,

notesStmt.note: Date of publication suggested by STC (2nd ed.)
Reproduction of original in the Society of Antiquaries.

place.placeName: Paternoster Rowe, next to the signe of the Castell
